## Slide 6: Pipeline Updates

**Pipeline Updates**

**Pipeline Growth**
*   Since mid-May 2023, ~$41m of new pipeline opportunities have been created.
*   Pipeline opportunity values are reduced by 20%, with a true up 6 months post go live, to ensure appropriate bookings to revenue conversion. Earlier stage large health system opportunities have also been reduced until we understand how they wish to contract/roll out.
*   Expansion opportunities for existing clients (e.g. UHS, Christus, Montefiore) are not included in the current pipeline.

**Assessments**
*   While Assessments will remain a key part of our new client acquisition strategy, we are no longer offering them in early-stage meetings, rather using them as part of deal acceleration strategy.
*   Of the current pipeline, only ~60% have been offered an Assessment, most of which are coming through Partner Referrals and/or older opportunities.
*   Christus Health recently closed without an Assessment (created July 2023), along with both Hendrick Health (created June 2023) and North Shore Edwards Elmhurst (created October 2023) expected to close without an Assessment over the next 60-90 days.

## Slide 8: Our goal is to reach $30M in CARR at EOY 2024

**Our goal is to reach $30M in CARR at EOY 2024**

$30M in CARR is 43 health system customers, assuming an average contract value (ACV) of $700K. We've currently signed 9 full contracts and one pilot (UCSF); thus, 34 net new health systems by EOY2024 means 1 customer per 1.7 weeks.

We believe this objective is achievable because:
*   At a macro level, we see continued tailwinds of margin compression and interest in AI.
    *   This has also driven new potential channel opportunities such as working with Vizient, Deloitte, Impact Advisors, and others.
*   At a market level, we estimate that only about 1 in 10 hospital CDI Directors, VPs Finance / Revenue Cycle, and CFOs know what we do, so there is significant potential for increasing market awareness.

## Slide 11: Our sales motion is more systematized

**Our sales motion is more systematized**

*   **Prospect** – Initial Sales Meeting scheduled & completed
*   **Qualified** – Qualification of interest & scheduled follow up steps post Initial Sales Meeting
*   **Active** – Additional meetings, demos, references, assessment discussion (as needed)
*   **Assessment** (7 sub-stages) – Assessment Approval through Assessment Delivery
*   **Finalist** – Either finalist on competitive sale and/or meetings post Assessment validation
*   **Vendor of Choice** – Explicit written and/or verbal communication that the client is ready to move forward
*   **Agreement Delivered** – SmarterDx sent agreements to client but no redlines received
*   **Contracting** - Receipt of contractual redlines from the client (excluding BAA)
*   **Executable** - All contractual changes agreed to by SmarterDx and the client. Routing for signature
*   **Closed Won** - Receipt of signed contract from client

## Slide 16: 2024 COGS methodology will better capture cost to support customers

**2024 COGS methodology will better capture cost to support customers**

| Component          | 2023 Methodology        | 2024 Methodology              | Rationale for Update                                                                                      |
| :----------------- | :---------------------- | :---------------------------- | :-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ClinOps Labor      | Allocate 55% of wages   | Cost per chart reviewed       | Only portion of ClinOps time actually spent reviewing cases is considered COGS                            |
| Engineering Labor  | Allocate 10% of wages   | Allocate 20% of 1 FTE         | Engineering time supporting live customers is not a function of engineering team size                     |
| Management Labor   | Allocate 10% of wages   | Allocate 5% of wages          | Updated time study on management time                                                                     |
| Hosting            | All AWS expenses        | Specific AWS line items       | Only line items related to hosting of data for live accounts included                                     |
| Software           | Select software         | Select software               | No change                                                                                                 |

smarterdx.com

## Slide 17: Overlaying updated COGS methodology on 2023 financials shows smoother gross margin profile converging at ~60%

**Overlaying updated COGS methodology on 2023 financials shows smoother gross margin profile converging at ~60%**

Applying the updated methodology of calculating COGS more closely ties our COGS to revenue, smoothing out the gross margin profile for the business. The table below shows what gross margins in 2023 would have been with the new COGS methodology. We should note that our current pilot contract with UCSF has negative gross margins by design (we gave them favorable terms to court the UC system) - the table below also shows COGS if the UCSF contract were excluded.

We are in the process of building internal tooling to better understand the cost per chart reviewed so all of these numbers are illustrative.

**2023 Gross Margins using current and updated methodology**

|           | Jan   | Feb   | Mar   | Apr   | May   | Jun   | Jul   | Aug   | Sep   |
| :-------- | :---- | :---- | :---- | :---- | :---- | :---- | :---- | :---- | :---- |
| Current Method | 49%   | 43%   | 59%   | 56%   | 45%   | 47%   | 53%   | 54%   | 35%   |
| New Method | 57%   | 53%   | 64%   | 59%   | 52%   | 53%   | 58%   | 67%   | 61%   |
| New Method excluding Pilots | 57%   | 67%   | 79%   | 74%   | 68%   | 69%   | 72%   | 77%   | 73%   |

## Slide 6: Pipeline Updates

**Pipeline Updates**

**Pipeline Growth**
*   Since mid-May 2023, ~$41m of new pipeline opportunities have been created.
*   Pipeline opportunity values are reduced by 20%, with a true up 6 months post go live, to ensure appropriate bookings to revenue conversion. Earlier stage large health system opportunities have also been reduced until we understand how they wish to contract/roll out.
*   Expansion opportunities for existing clients (e.g. UHS, Christus, Montefiore) are not included in the current pipeline.

**Assessments**
*   While Assessments will remain a key part of our new client acquisition strategy, we are no longer offering them in early-stage meetings, rather using them as part of deal acceleration strategy.
*   Of the current pipeline, only ~60% have been offered an Assessment, most of which are coming through Partner Referrals and/or older opportunities.
*   Christus Health recently closed without an Assessment (created July 2023), along with both Hendrick Health (created June 2023) and North Shore Edwards Elmhurst (created October 2023) expected to close without an Assessment over the next 60-90 days.

## Slide 8: Our goal is to reach $30M in CARR at EOY 2024

**Our goal is to reach $30M in CARR at EOY 2024**

$30M in CARR is 43 health system customers, assuming an average contract value (ACV) of $700K. We've currently signed 9 full contracts and one pilot (UCSF); thus, 34 net new health systems by EOY2024 means 1 customer per 1.7 weeks.

We believe this objective is achievable because:
*   At a macro level, we see continued tailwinds of margin compression and interest in AI.
    *   This has also driven new potential channel opportunities such as working with Vizient, Deloitte, Impact Advisors, and others.
*   At a market level, we estimate that only about 1 in 10 hospital CDI Directors, VPs Finance / Revenue Cycle, and CFOs know what we do, so there is significant potential for increasing market awareness.

## Slide 11: Our sales motion is more systematized

**Our sales motion is more systematized**

*   **Prospect** – Initial Sales Meeting scheduled & completed
*   **Qualified** – Qualification of interest & scheduled follow up steps post Initial Sales Meeting
*   **Active** – Additional meetings, demos, references, assessment discussion (as needed)
*   **Assessment** (7 sub-stages) – Assessment Approval through Assessment Delivery
*   **Finalist** – Either finalist on competitive sale and/or meetings post Assessment validation
*   **Vendor of Choice** – Explicit written and/or verbal communication that the client is ready to move forward
*   **Agreement Delivered** – SmarterDx sent agreements to client but no redlines received
*   **Contracting** - Receipt of contractual redlines from the client (excluding BAA)
*   **Executable** - All contractual changes agreed to by SmarterDx and the client. Routing for signature
*   **Closed Won** - Receipt of signed contract from client

## Slide 16: 2024 COGS methodology will better capture cost to support customers

**2024 COGS methodology will better capture cost to support customers**

| Component         | 2023 Methodology        | 2024 Methodology              | Rationale for Update                                                                                   |
| :---------------- | :---------------------- | :---------------------------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ClinOps Labor     | Allocate 55% of wages   | Cost per chart reviewed       | Only portion of ClinOps time actually spent reviewing cases is considered COGS                         |
| Engineering Labor | Allocate 10% of wages   | Allocate 20% of 1 FTE         | Engineering time supporting live customers is not a function of engineering team size                  |
| Management Labor  | Allocate 10% of wages   | Allocate 5% of wages          | Updated time study on management time                                                                  |
| Hosting           | All AWS expenses        | Specific AWS line items       | Only line items related to hosting of data for live accounts included                                  |
| Software          | Select software         | Select software               | No change                                                                                              |

smarterdx.com

## Slide 17: Overlaying updated COGS methodology on 2023 financials shows smoother gross margin profile converging at ~60%

**Overlaying updated COGS methodology on 2023 financials shows smoother gross margin profile converging at ~60%**

Applying the updated methodology of calculating COGS more closely ties our COGS to revenue, smoothing out the gross margin profile for the business. The table below shows what gross margins in 2023 would have been with the new COGS methodology. We should note that our current pilot contract with UCSF has negative gross margins by design (we gave them favorable terms to court the UC system) - the table below also shows COGS if the UCSF contract were excluded.

We are in the process of building internal tooling to better understand the cost per chart reviewed so all of these numbers are illustrative.

**2023 Gross Margins using current and updated methodology**

|                     | Jan | Feb | Mar | Apr | May | Jun | Jul | Aug | Sep |
| :------------------ | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |
| Current Method      | 49% | 43% | 59% | 56% | 45% | 47% | 53% | 54% | 35% |
| New Method          | 57% | 53% | 64% | 59% | 52% | 53% | 58% | 67% | 61% |
| New Method excluding Pilots | 57% | 67% | 79% | 74% | 68% | 69% | 72% | 77% | 73% |

## Slide 26: Are there other financing options that can extend our runway?

**Are there other financing options that can extend our runway?**

Once the economics and predictability of the Prebill product are more established, we may be in a position to explore alternative ways to raise capital for Prebill expansion. We are interested in getting the Board's perspective on the following, as well as other financing methods we should consider:

| Instrument                | Venture Debt                 | Lines of Credit               | Recurring Revenue Advance |
| :------------------------ | :--------------------------- | :---------------------------- | :------------------------ |
| Size of loan              | $10-$50M (at $25M+ ARR)      | 3-6x MRR 80% of AR (if asset backed) | 3-6x MRR                  |
| Seniority                 | Senior blanket lien likely   | Senior blanket lien           | N/A                       |
| Interest rate             | Higher                       | Lower                         | Higher                    |
| Tenor                     | 36-60 months                 | 12-24 months                  | <12 months                |
| Covenants                 | Possible                     | Possible                      | None                      |
| Warrants                  | Yes (i.e. dilutive)          | Possible                      | None                      |

## Slide 29: An audit is too heavyweight, but technical accounting support could be helpful

**An audit is too heavyweight, but technical accounting support could be helpful**

*   Burkland is largely an operational accounting partner. While their support has been sufficient for day-to-day accounting needs, they haven't sufficiently supported our technical accounting needs
*   For 2024, it could make sense to layer on a relationship with a technical accounting advisory firm that can double check key accounting policies like revenue and COGS recognition
*   It's management's perspective that an audit for FY2023 isn't worth the effort at our current scale. We should be able to realize the majority of the benefit of an audit through engagement of accounting advisors on targeted parts of our financial systems
